title: Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that discuss ethics in natural language processing (NLP) and best practices. These articles cover a range of topics including bias, fairness, transparency, and the societal impact of NLP technologies
**"Fairness and Abstraction in Sociotechnical Systems"** by Selbst
Discusses the complexities of fairness in sociotechnical systems, including NLP
**"Gender Bias in Contextualized Word Embeddings"** by Zhao, Jieyu, et al
Investigates gender bias in word embeddings and proposes methods to mitigate it
**"Mitigating Unwanted Biases with Adversarial Learning"** by Zhang, Brian Hu, et al
Explores adversarial learning techniques to reduce biases in NLP models
**"Man is to Computer Programmer as Woman is to Homemaker? Debiasing Word Embeddings"** by Bolukbasi, Tolga, et al
Examines gender biases in word embeddings and presents methods to debias them
**"Algorithmic Fairness"** by Barocas, Solon, et al
Provides a comprehensive overview of fairness in algorithmic systems, including NLP
**"Ethics and NLP: A General Survey"** by Hovy
Surveys ethical considerations in NLP research and applications
Discusses the challenges and importance of interpretability in machine learning models
**"Data Statements for NLP: Toward Mitigating System Bias and Enabling Better Science"** by Bender
Proposes the use of data statements to improve transparency and reduce bias in NLP datasets
**"A Survey on Bias and Fairness in Machine Learning"** by Mehrabi, Ninareh, et al
Reviews various types of biases and fairness issues in machine learning, including NLP
**"The Ethics of Using NLP for Mental Health Applications"** by Chancellor
Discusses ethical considerations in using NLP for mental health diagnostics and interventions
**"On the Dangers of Stochastic Parrots: Can Language Models Be Too Big?"** by Bender
Examines the risks associated with large language models, including ethical concerns
**"Discriminative but Not Discriminatory: A Comparison of Fairness Definitions under Different Worldviews"** by Friedler, Sorelle A., et al
Compares different definitions of fairness and their implications for NLP
**"Bias in Bios: A Case Study of Semantic Representation Bias in a High-Stakes Setting"** by De-Arteaga, Maria, et al
Analyzes bias in semantic representations in professional bios and its impact
**"Ethical Implications of Deep Learning in NLP"** by Floridi
Discusses the ethical implications of deep learning advancements in NLP
**"The Role of Data in AI Ethics"** by Mittelstadt
Explores the ethical role of data in AI systems, including NLP applications
**"Fairness and Accountability Design Needs for Algorithmic Support in High-Stakes Public Sector Decision-Making"** by Veale
Investigates fairness and accountability in algorithmic decision-making in the public sector
**"Algorithmic Bias Detection and Mitigation: Best Practices and Policies to Reduce Consumer Harms"** by U.S
Provides guidelines for detecting and mitigating algorithmic bias
**"Ethics in NLP Research: A Survey of Best Practices and Challenges"** by Fort, KarÃ«n, et al
Surveys best practices and challenges in conducting ethical NLP research
**"The Social Impact of Natural Language Processing"** by Hovy
Discusses the broader social impact of NLP technologies
**"Towards a Rigorous Science of Interpretable Machine Learning"** by Doshi-Velez, Finale, and Kim
Advocates for rigorous scientific methods to improve the interpretability of machine learning models
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the ethical considerations and best practices in the field of NLP up to
